text: so with an embedded HubSpot form you can easily fire JS from the on success event after a form is submitted
can you do similar with the regular form module in HubSpot?
like say i want to add a body class after a form is submitted that uses an inline response instead of a redirect
basically looking for a way to do something like this... but not using an embedded form, using a native HubSpot form module

it sounds like you’re trying to override a redirect and show an inline message instead, is that right? I suspect I’m misunderstanding something, because that’s a feature you can choose in the editor :slightly_smiling_face:
The closest we have to what you are looking to do <@U24GZQ3GF> is global form events <https://developers.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>
The key/issue is that these are async so you can’t block a redirect or inline thank you message with them
Thanks Zack! I'll look into that documentation.
